Description: About one half, preserving completely profile, of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; low, convex wall with slightly incurving rim and low ring foot; wholly glazed save for band at junction of wall and foot, resting surface and centre of underside, which has a dot and ring; inscription cut on reserved part of underside. Stacking ring on floor.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), Found in the area between the sanctuaries of the Dioskouroi and Apollo (see Petrie 1886, 16)
Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Found in the area between the sanctuaries of the Dioskouroi and Apollo (see Petrie 1886, 16)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXV, no. 697a)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1783)
